t: Psalm 109
Plea for Judgment of False Accusers
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
Do*pn not keep silent, O*ld God of my praise!
For*ld the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful Have*ld opened against me; They*ld have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
They*ld have also surrounded me with words of hatred, And*ld fought against me without a cause.
In*ld return for my love they are my accusers, But*ld I give*i myself*i to*i prayer.
Thus*ld they have rewarded me evil for good, And*ld hatred for my love.
Set*ln a wicked man over him, And*ld let an accuser stand at his right hand.
When*ld he is judged, let him be found guilty, And*ld let his prayer become sin.
Let*ld his days be few, And*ild let another take his office.
Let*ld his children be fatherless, And*ld his wife a widow.
Let*ld his children continually be vagabonds, and beg; Let*ld them seek their*i bread*i also from their desolate places.
Let*ld the creditor seize all that he has, And*ld let strangers plunder his labor.
Let*ld there be none to extend mercy to him, Nor*ld let there be any to favor his fatherless children.
Let*ld his posterity be cut off, And*ild in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
Let*ln the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord,*s And*ld let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
Let*ld them be continually before the Lord,*s That*ld He may cut off the memory of them from the earth;
Because*ld he did not remember to show mercy, But*ld persecuted the poor and needy man, That*ld he might even slay the broken in heart.
As*ld he loved cursing, so let it come to him; As*ld he did not delight in blessing, so let it be far from him.
As*ld he clothed himself with cursing as with his garment, So*ld let it enter his body like water, And*ld like oil into his bones.
Let*ld it be to him like the garment which covers him, And*ld for a belt with which he girds himself continually.
Let*ild this be*i the Lord’s*s reward to my accusers, And*ld to those who speak evil against my person.
But*ln You, O God*s the Lord, Deal*ld with me for Your name’s sake; Because*ld Your mercy is*i good, deliver me.
For*ld I am*i poor and needy, And*ld my heart is wounded within me.
I*ld am gone like a shadow when it lengthens; I*ld am shaken off like a locust.
My*ld knees are weak through fasting, And*ld my flesh is feeble from lack of fatness.
I*ld also have become a reproach to them; When*ild they look at me, they shake their heads.
Help*ln me, O Lord*s my God! Oh,*ld save me according to Your mercy,
That*ld they may know that this is*i Your hand— That*ild You, Lord,*s have done it!
Let*ld them curse, but You bless; When*ld they arise, let them be ashamed, But*ld let Your servant rejoice.
Let*ld my accusers be clothed with shame, And*ld let them cover themselves with their own disgrace as with a mantle.
I*ln will greatly praise the Lord*s with my mouth; Yes,*ld I will praise Him among the multitude.
For*ld He shall stand at the right hand of the poor, To*ld save him*i from those who condemn him.
